CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 15, 1951, pg. 1, reads: "[Illegible] Clothes to Korea - Cold weather kept most [il.] kindergarten class, taught by Mrs. Peggy Long in Fitz [il.] Pa., from making the bus trip to Centre Avenue Police Station Wednesday morning so they could donate clothes to Korea, but the teacher and three of her pupils made the [il.] anyhow. They are, left to right: Irene Harris, Mrs. Long, [il.] Baker, and Darlene Baker, shown making their donation of clothing.  Police explained that you don't have to come all the way to Centre Avenue Station.  Just drop your clothes at the nearest police or fire station. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Peggy Long squatting over suitcase surrounded by three girls including Irene Harris and Darlene Baker, in Centre Avenue police station for clothing drive for Korea
